body: Republican presidential candidates from left, Chris Christie, Marco Rubio, Ben Carson, Scott Walker, Donald Trump, Jeb Bush, Mike Huckabee, Ted Cruz, Rand Paul, and John Kasich take the stage for the first Republican presidential debate at the Quicken Loans Arena Thursday, Aug. 6, 2015, in Cleveland. (AP Photo/John Minchillo)  Teachers around the country were watching the Aug. 6 debate in Cleveland in which 10 candidates for the Republican presidential nomination sparred and posed questions on Twitter that they would like to see them answer. The next GOP debate is scheduled for Wednesday, Sept. 16, at the Reagan Library in Simi Valley, California, and here are some of the questions that teachers tweeted to the hashtag #BATSask, a reference to the BATS, the Badass Teachers Association, a group founded in 2013 by educators sick and tired of being blamed for whatever woes exist in the public education system. Here are some of the tweets. If you have questions to add the list, put them in the comments and I’ll do an update before the next debate.   —  #BatsAsk #GopDebate will Christie address foreign dignitaries like he does teachers? @bretbaier — Maria Glass (@mariaglass7) August 7, 2015 —  #BATsAsk @BadassTeachersA Can any candidate explain this? pic.twitter.com/T7HxKjetVw — Karen Adlum (@twitturbug9) August 7, 2015  —  What kind of choice is it when there aren’t ANY public schools left? #BATsAsk #GOPDebate — PennBat (@PennBat) August 7, 2015 —  I want to know who will actually get rid of high stakes testing and CCSS? #BATSask #GOPDebate @BadassTeachersA https://t.co/sAaD0ichow — Ohio BATs (@OhioBATs) August 7, 2015 —  #BATSask do you understand teacher tenure is due process, not a job for life? Protect from unfair firing? http://t.co/u7ADkThLEu #GOPDebate — Steven Singer (@StevenSinger3) August 7, 2015  —  #BATSAsk which #GOPDebate candidate is ready to RESPECT teachers and #unions? @BernieSanders pic.twitter.com/oy9ajsrhUu — Nancy Osborne (@NancyOsborne180) August 7, 2015 —  #BATSask would you listen to #teachers about bad high stakes test questions or legally hush them up? https://t.co/1NK9zaZxaz #GOPDebate — Steven Singer (@StevenSinger3) August 7, 2015  —  “We fought the teachers union”–.@ChrisChristie …and how did that improve New Jersey schools? #BATsAsk #GOPDebate .@NJBatsa — PennBat (@PennBat) August 7, 2015 —  #BATSAsk which #GOPdebate candidate is willing to put the humanity back into education? @berniesanders pic.twitter.com/6dTpeJN0go — Susan DuFresne1 (@GetUpStandUp2) August 7, 2015  —
title: Teachers pose some pointed questions for next GOP debate
